001/*

003 * Copyright (c) 2022 rlkraft@pnw.edu
004 * See LICENSE for details.

006
007package renderer.models_T;
008
009import renderer.scene.*;
010import renderer.scene.primitives.*;
011
012/**
013   Create a solid model of a cube with its center
014   at the origin, having edge length 2, and with its
015   corners at {@code (±1, ±1, ±1)}.
016<p>
017   This version of the cube model has each face of
018   the cube cut up by an n by m grid of lines.
019<p>
020   Here is a picture showing how the cube's eight
021   corners are labeled.
022<pre>{@code
023                  v4=(-1,1,-1)
024                  +---------------------+ v5=(1,1,-1)
025                 /|                    /|
026                / |                   / |
027               /  |                  /  |
028              /   |                 /   |
029             /    |                /    |
030         v7 +---------------------+ v6  |
031            |     |               |     |
032            |     |               |     |
033            |     | v0=(-1,-1,-1) |     |
034            |     +---------------|-----+ v1=(1,-1,-1)
035            |    /                |    /
036            |   /                 |   /
037            |  /                  |  /
038            | /                   | /
039            |/                    |/
040            +---------------------+
041            v3=(-1,-1,1)          v2=(1,-1,1)
042}</pre>
043
044   @see Cube
045   @see Cube3
046   @see Cube4
047*/
048public class Cube2 extends Model
049{
050   /**
051      Create a cube with its center at the origin, having edge
052      length 2, with its corners at {@code (±1, ±1, ±1)}. and
053      with two perpendicular grid lines going across the middle
054      of each of the cube's faces.
055   */
056   public Cube2( )
057   {
058      this(1, 1, 1);
059   }
060
061
062   /**
063      Create a cube with its center at the origin, having edge
064      length 2, with its corners at {@code (±1, ±1, ±1)}, and
065      with each of the cube's faces containing the given number
066      of grid lines parallel to the x, y, and z directions.
067
068      @param xGrid  number of grid lines perpendicular to the x-axis
069      @param yGrid  number of grid lines perpendicular to the y-axis
070      @param zGrid  number of grid lines perpendicular to the z-axis
071      @throws IllegalArgumentException if {@code xGrid} is less than 0
072      @throws IllegalArgumentException if {@code yGrid} is less than 0
073      @throws IllegalArgumentException if {@code zGrid} is less than 0
074   */
075   public Cube2(final int xGrid, final int yGrid, final int zGrid)
076   {
077      super("Cube2");
078
079      if (xGrid < 0)
080         throw new IllegalArgumentException("xGrid must be greater than or equal to 0");
081      if (yGrid < 0)
082         throw new IllegalArgumentException("yGrid must be greater than or equal to 0");
083      if (zGrid < 0)
084         throw new IllegalArgumentException("zGrid must be greater than or equal to 0");
085
086      final double xStep = 2.0 / (1 + xGrid),
087                   yStep = 2.0 / (1 + yGrid),
088                   zStep = 2.0 / (1 + zGrid);
089
090      // Create the top and bottom sides of the cube.
091      // Arrays of indices to be used to create the triangles.
092      final int[][] vT = new int[xGrid+2][zGrid+2];
093            int[][] vB = new int[xGrid+2][zGrid+2];
094      int vIndex = 0;
095      // Create vertices for the top and bottom sides.
096      for (int i = 0; i < xGrid + 2; ++i)
097      {
098         for (int j = 0; j < zGrid + 2; ++j)
099         {
100            addVertex(new Vertex(-1 + i * xStep,  1, -1 + j * zStep),
101                      new Vertex(-1 + i * xStep, -1, -1 + j * zStep));
102            vT[i][j] = vIndex + 0;
103            vB[i][j] = vIndex + 1;
104            vIndex += 2;
105         }
106      }
107      // Create triangles for the top and bottom sides.
108      for (int i = 0; i < xGrid + 1; ++i)
109      {
110         for (int j = 0; j < zGrid + 1; ++j)
111         {
112            addPrimitive(new Triangle(vT[i][j],     vT[i][j+1], vT[i+1][j+1]),
113                         new Triangle(vT[i+1][j+1], vT[i+1][j], vT[i][j]));
114
115            addPrimitive(new Triangle(vB[i][j],     vB[i+1][j], vB[i+1][j+1]),
116                         new Triangle(vB[i+1][j+1], vB[i][j+1], vB[i][j]));
117         }
118      }
119
120
121      // Create the front and back sides of the cube.
122      // Arrays of indices to be used to create the triangles.
123      final int[][] vF = new int[yGrid+2][xGrid+2];
124                    vB = new int[yGrid+2][xGrid+2];
125      // Create vertices for the front and back sides.
126      for (int i = 0; i < yGrid + 2; ++i)
127      {
128         for (int j = 0; j < xGrid + 2; ++j)
129         {
130            addVertex(new Vertex(-1 + j * xStep, -1 + i * yStep,  1),
131                      new Vertex(-1 + j * xStep, -1 + i * yStep, -1));
132            vF[i][j] = vIndex + 0;
133            vB[i][j] = vIndex + 1;
134            vIndex += 2;
135         }
136      }
137      // Create triangles for the front and back sides.
138      for (int i = 0; i < yGrid + 1; ++i)
139      {
140         for (int j = 0; j < xGrid + 1; ++j)
141         {
142            addPrimitive(new Triangle(vF[i][j],     vF[i][j+1], vF[i+1][j+1]),
143                         new Triangle(vF[i+1][j+1], vF[i+1][j], vF[i][j]));
144
145            addPrimitive(new Triangle(vB[i][j],     vB[i+1][j], vB[i+1][j+1]),
146                         new Triangle(vB[i+1][j+1], vB[i][j+1], vB[i][j]));
147         }
148      }
149
150
151      // Create the right and left sides of the cube.
152      // Arrays of indices to be used to create the triangles.
153      final int[][] vR = new int[yGrid+2][zGrid+2],
154                    vL = new int[yGrid+2][zGrid+2];
155      // Create vertices for the right and left sides.
156      for (int i = 0; i < yGrid + 2; ++i)
157      {
158         for (int j = 0; j < zGrid + 2; ++j)
159         {
160            addVertex(new Vertex( 1, -1 + i * yStep, -1 + j * zStep),
161                      new Vertex(-1, -1 + i * yStep, -1 + j * zStep));
162            vR[i][j] = vIndex + 0;
163            vL[i][j] = vIndex + 1;
164            vIndex += 2;
165         }
166      }
167      // Create triangles for the right and left sides.
168      for (int i = 0; i < yGrid + 1; ++i)
169      {
170         for (int j = 0; j < zGrid + 1; ++j)
171         {
172            addPrimitive(new Triangle(vR[i][j],     vR[i+1][j], vR[i+1][j+1]),
173                         new Triangle(vR[i+1][j+1], vR[i][j+1], vR[i][j]));
174
175            addPrimitive(new Triangle(vL[i][j],     vL[i][j+1], vL[i+1][j+1]),
176                         new Triangle(vL[i+1][j+1], vL[i+1][j], vL[i][j]));
177         }
178      }
179   }
180}//Cube2
